storyText: Tap Select Recommended!
It'll pick your gear for you!
Classes have abilities but also restrictions.
Be aware that each class can
equip different weapons.
Call upon nightmares you've captured in battle.
They're super strong, so set them to work.
Time to forfeit those shimmering rocks you so desire: twilight crystals.
And in return...
You get treasures we've collected from different stories.
Now to teach you how to upgrade!
Start with a weapon with a high rarity as your base.
Feed it any materials you don't need!
Skill level is the most important. So aim to raise
the skill level of your favorite weapons to Lv. 5!
It's really easy! Even a mangy mutt could do it!
We'll unlock a new feature for you!
Don't miss those limited-time events!
We'll unlock a new feature for you!
Help out your comrades and win their admiration!
You'll get special medals for fighting with
your friends in co-op battles!
Collect medals and trade them for limited classes and more!
Here you can equip weapons in your sub-set.
You can't use skills from weapons set as sub gear,
but your stats will get a little boost.
You can expand your sub-set as your rank increases.
Lastly, a word of caution...
You can't equip the same weapon in both main and sub-sets.
If you can't choose, just tap Select Recommended!
Look at how strong you've become.
Now get out there and start gatherin' lifeforce.
Join a guild and participate in the Colosseum!
You'll get rewards just by joining a guild.
Enter a guild with lots of people so you can mooch off 'em!
Congrats on joining a guild!
You're now invited to a true death match: the Colosseum!
Great work!
But you're just gettin' started!
You gotta keep on winning.
The Colosseum is hard, but the rewards are worth it.
Colosseum rewards will make you even stronger.
You can get super strong classes!
You can also get weapons dear to the authors!
But first, you gotta keep fighting in the Colosseum.
We'll show you how to equip stuff!
Different classes have different
gear they can and can't use.
We'll hide weapons you can't equip.
But it's not like we're stealin' them from you,
so relax! Tsk.
Congrats! You've unlocked the Act of Reality!
Now you'll finally find out the sins your characters hide...
And to match the tone, we've changed the background music.
If you prefer the previous background music, change it
by going to Menu > Options > Music.
Take it easy!
The story of April Fools dates back to
France's adoption of the Gregorian calendar.
France used to ring in the new year on April 1.
But in the year 1564, King Charles IX
Decided to switch to January 1, per the Gregorian system.
Naturally, the citizens handling the festivities were livid.
They fought back by celebrating a false new year on April 1.
That foolish ballyhoo was passed down continuously
and became the April Fools we know today.
Do you feel like you get it now?
But April Fools falls on April 1.
That's an April fool.
The story of April Fools dates back to
France's adoption of the Gregorian calendar.
France used to ring in the new year on April 1.
But in the year 1564, King Charles IX
Decided to switch to January 1, per the Gregorian system.
Naturally, the citizens handling the festivities were livid.
They fought back by celebrating a false new year on April 1.
That foolish ballyhoo was passed down continuously
and became the April Fools we know today.
Wait a second, is this looping?
Could it be all that about getting crystals…
April Loops?
The story of April Fools dates back to
France's adoption of the Gregorian calendar.
France used to ring in the new year on April 1.
But in the year 1564, King Charles IX
Decided to switch to January 1, per the Gregorian system.
Naturally, the citizens handling the festivities were livid.
They fought back by celebrating a false new year on April 1.
That foolish ballyhoo was passed down continuously
and became the April Fools we know today.
Wait a moment. Do you feel a hint of déjà vu?
Could it be all that about getting crystals…
...was an April fools joke?
Who should our next collaboration be with?
We could go for, you know, that one game...
But to attract a whole new audience,
we want to seek out all kinds of surprise collaborations!
There's been a lot more lately.
Like of a man-free world…
It really pulls my strings!
I'm sure you want to know why!
Did men just vanish right out of the world?
Or did something cause the male population to dwindle?
I demand answers!
But you can't go forgetting what day April 1 is!
That's an April fool.
Dear reader, did you know?
There's a certain rumor surrounding April Fools...
That is...
"The lies we tell on April Fools don't come true."
That's the idea!
So if those lies are imbued with even the faintest of hopes...
If they're told on April 1,
they won't come true.
Isn't that ironic?
If your hopes for a collaboration are false, they won't be true either.
But this could all turn out to be idle gossip.
After all, April 1...
Well, that's April Fools Day!
The story of April Fools dates back to
France's adoption of the Gregorian calendar.
France used to ring in the new year on April 1.
But in the year 1564, King Charles IX
Decided to switch to January 1, per the Gregorian system.
Naturally, the citizens handling the festivities were livid.
They fought back by celebrating a false new year on April 1.
That foolish ballyhoo was passed down continuously
and became the April Fools we know today.
Wait a second, is this looping?
Could it be all that about getting crystals…
April Loops?
On April Fools Day, you can get away with lying.
A special day indeed.
But that doesn't mean you can only tell lies.
Sometimes you tell the truth.
So the part about getting crystals is true!
You helped us out with this headache of a picture-hunt.
Thank you very much!
Have a present of 100 crystals!
Thank you for trusting us!
Thank you so much, for now and every time!
We hope you get every bit of enjoyment you can.
We'll keep giving it our all!
Oh, and that's not a lie!
Absolutely true!
Look how many points you've accumulated!
At last, it's time to unlock a new power!
You can take up to three of these powers into the Colosseum!
But you can only change while reloading your weapon!
Now, take this power and go gather lots of lifeforce!
Hello hello!
We heard plenty of you saying, "I don't get what to do!"\n So here we are to give some advice.
Well, not that it's a particularly confusing game anyway.
In short: play the story, collect crystals, summon from the grimoire\n and upgrade your weapons.
We've added a feature in the top left called Rookies' Path,\n so give it a tap if you're lost!
In general, tap the arrow button to complete the tasks.
Clear the entire guide and you'll get an Alice/Mage!
Go dive on in!
Is your gear list just about full?
Is your present box just about to burst?
Well, good news!
Inventory management is now unlocked!
It'll help clear out that mountain of a present box!
And no more not being able to find your gear in the list!
Gather it all up for a nice, satisfying purge!
Perfect for you stuff-it-in-the-drawer types!
Put it in storage and it won't up and disappear!
No need to worry about time limits for claiming!
Why not clean out your present box?
Until next time!
All goes bye-bye!
Good news for all you limit breakers!\nYou can unlock new abilities by limit breaking!
Mind telling us what that is?
Listen and be amazed! For it's called a limit break skill!
...That's it?
Lame. They didn't even try to be creative.
Well, tell us how it works.
Right now we have story, Colosseum, and Colosseum support skills. But this new addition makes four!
It'll boost your stats and buff you up at the beginning of battle. At least, that's the plan.
The heck's that supposed to mean?
Some of the effects are still in development.
...That's not surprising. I'll keep my hopes up.
And? So how do they work?
All you gotta do is limit break an SR with the skill to unlock it.
Then, set that weapon in your deck's "slot" to activate the effect.
"Slot"?
Yeah. Well, it's not available yet, but it will be! Give it some time.
Aren't you getting ahead of yourself?
Anyway, just start preparing! Limit break your weapons!
What he said.
...Kehehehe.
This will make gathering desires more efficient.
I think they heard you, Noya.
Did they? My bad.
If you're still confused, check out the help page.
Are you bored of your guildship's design?
Then do we got good news for you!
Now there's a feature to customize the appearance of your guildship.
We call it, "Guildship Revamp".
With this, you can metamorphosize
your guildship any way you like!
Soar on a ship with aesthetics.\nThat's what you really want.
But first you gotta get "parts"
for your ship.
You can change your guildship's looks by
replacing your current parts with the new ones.
Not only will you fly in style, but
your ship will also get an HP boost!
The more parts you acquire, the less
likely you'll be shot down at the Colosseum.
You can purchase parts using guildship points,
which you can earn as rewards at the Colosseum.
And when you do make a kick-ass lookin'
guildship ready to steal all that lifeforce,
show it off to other guilds by posting it online.
Mmh...?
Looks like we've come to a split in the road.
That's right!
One path takes you to the continuation of the main scenario.
Gotcha.
The other path leads to a sub quest.
There you can view some extra stuff not shown in the other.
Makes sense!
You don't actually HAVE to do the sub quests. Just focus on the main story if that's all you care about.
But they're here if you ever wanna come back.
Kee-hee-hee.
Heehee…
